Articles.Content:
THE REACH 0.9.2

Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License.

 

The Reach is a unique solar system replacer mod, made completely from handdrawn textures.
It aims to change the normal Kerbolar system to be generally more interesting and special.

Planets:

Spoiler
  • Claudius: A double, orange star
  • Mire: A lonely Moholike planet, but purpleish
  • Reliquum: A Kerbin-sized world, with an oxygenated atmosphere and mostly deserts
    • Ulaan: Reliquum's companion, airless and roughly the size of Duna
  • Kerra: The homeworld, with beautiful rings
    • Inola: A purple-ish Minmus-sized moon
    • Ilia: Inola but blue
    • Berren: Mun-sized moon, pretty inclined orbit
  • Liquen: An oceanic superkerbin, with a tenuous atmosphere
  • Vessa: Dres 2.0, but with icy poles
  • Ger: Superrotating saturnlike planet, with a huge ring system
    • Aal and Oon: a binairy moon, both somewhat blue
    • Ser: Purple-ish Mun-sized object with a thin atmosphere
  • Sherpen: A megajool ice giant, of over 600 times the mass of Kerbin, allowing Duna-sized moons
    • Woola: Icy jungle moon, habitable to Kerbals (will be changed next update)
    • Forsal: Eeloo 2
    • Foon: Solid moon in high orbit, with NH3 oceans and atmosphere
  • Menal: Icy megakerbin, basically as hard to land on as Jool

Credits:

Me: for the configs and art
Squad: ksp
Thomas P: Kopernicus

Download:

https://spacedock.info/mod/2290/The Reach

 

Edited December 22, 2019 by Gjaspar
forgot the download link :p

Hi - am attempting to try your mod but am having a major error at startup: "Kopernicus was not able to load the custom planetary system ..."

I've gathered the files that the error message mentions (as well as the error message itself) in this folder:

https://drive.google.com/open?id=1CVjNf_4CVrnjUUpGhnpV1DlDBrnTRPhv

Hopefully you'll spot something I've done wrong.

9 hours ago, OrbitalManeuvers said:

Hi - am attempting to try your mod but am having a major error at startup: "Kopernicus was not able to load the custom planetary system ..."

I've gathered the files that the error message mentions (as well as the error message itself) in this folder:

https://drive.google.com/open?id=1CVjNf_4CVrnjUUpGhnpV1DlDBrnTRPhv

Hopefully you'll spot something I've done wrong.

Sorry for the issue! Early acces, baby

Fixed the issue and updated the mod on spacedock, hope you have fun!

P.S. it is advised to install scatterer, the mod looks weird and inaccurate without it, and mods like AVP, SVE and Spectra are not compatible.

2 hours ago, Gjaspar said:

Sorry for the issue! Early acces, baby

Yes, totally understood. I'm on the cutting edge and have no expectations of success

And to that end, I regret to report that after updating to 0.9.3, removing SVE, and installing scatterer, I am still getting the same Kopernicus message at startup.

I have updated my drive folder. There should now be a "Report-01" folder (the first files I uploaded) and a "Report-02" folder. The 02 folder is the results of the updates described above.

I left the EVE folder itself - please let me know if that's an issue. I was thinking that without configs it wouldn't affect anything.

https://drive.google.com/open?id=1CVjNf_4CVrnjUUpGhnpV1DlDBrnTRPhv

Thanks for the reply!

Thanks for the reply!

It looks like I updated the mod with the wrong file, dont you just love it when that happens? :p

Hope it actually works now, have fun!

Badda-bing, we're in! At least, there's something very different about the planet on my startup screen .. so I'm taking that as a sign of success.  I resisted the temptation to jump into the tracking station because I was hoping you might have some advice/recommendations. I've been on 1.8 for a while now, but here's why I went back to 1.7, grabbed your mod, and tried Kopernicus for the first time ...

I was hoping to start a science game in a solar system that I know absolutely nothing about. I've purposefully not read anything about any of the planets, or how many there are or anything, just because I was hoping to see if I can mod my way into a totally new game experience where everything has to be discovered. Do you have any experience with Tarsier/ResearchBodies? Any idea if they would work with your planet pack? I really don't want to play career, and ResearchBodies says you really should in order to use it, so I'm just fishing for ideas at this point.

In any event - thanks for helping me to get it running!

I dont have any experience with ResearchBodies, but I do know from what I've read from the thread is that it is not currently compatible with my mod: I would need to make a config for it. I might do it next update? But on the other hand, that would take a lot of time to make

1 minute ago, Gjaspar said:

I dont have any experience with ResearchBodies, but I do know from what I've read from the thread is that it is not currently compatible with my mod: I would need to make a config for it. I might do it next update? But on the other hand, that would take a lot of time to make

I've never used it either, so I had no idea what's involved. Anyway, good to know! I think for now what I'll try is a new science game where I'm just very careful about the map view and tracking station

@OrbitalManeuvers Interesting mod. You might want to add moar screenshots to the OP, to get moar clicks

Also, mebbe adding download link would be good too?

Overall I like the mod. One of the better first mods made by a person new to the planet modding community. I think the non atmospheric worlds textures need a bit off work on the textures. But overall it's pretty solid for a first timer.
@Stone Blue it's not my mod

yup... I see that.... nao...

@Gjaspar

@Stone Blue thanks for reminding me, lmao

download is now included in the post!
Great mod! Pretty good for a first timer!
@Gjaspar Hiya, hope you're staying well and safe.  Any idea if this should work as-is with 1.8.1?
